text.paragraph:
ULH FIN L998-3300-9644 Date(s): 2022-12-10 - 2022-12-24
Williams-Davidson 72870 Alexander Green Port Brianna, KY 40202- US (502) 562-4370
Encounter Diagnosis
Acquired thrombocytopenia (Discharge Diagnosis) - 2022-12-15
Itching (Discharge Diagnosis) - 2022-12-21
Discharge Disposition: OP Self Care or Home
Attending Physician: Jones, MD-ONC
Admitting Physician: Jones, MD-ONC
Referring Physician: Jones, MD-ONC

tr.td:
Patient is 53 y/o male with coronary artery disease s/p MI and CABG, peripheral vascular disease, hepatitis C referred to clinic due to thrombocytopenia. Decreased platelets present since at least 6/2021 and there are in range 37,000-61,0000/ul. Patient denies bleeding, night sweats, fevers, weight loss. He noted easy bruising.
For 20 years he reports drinking weekly 12 beers and 4 shots of liquor.
Abdomen US 2022-09-03 -coarsened liver echotexture with increased liver echogenicity consistent with
underlying hepatocellular disease, spleen 11 cm, cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.
Previous tests:
2022-04-14 WBC 6.8, Hb 13.4, plt 40
2022-08-31 WBC 6.4, Hb 9.7, plt 39, CMP abnormal for sodium 129, glucose 273, creat 1.76, PT 13.3
2022-09-02 WBC 5.5, Hb 10.4, plt 53, ferritin 146, trans sat 19, folate 22, vit B12 197
During initial visit in clinic on 2022-09-23 WBC 6.7, Hb 12.6, platelets 50
Peripheral blood smear showed few dysplastic lymphocytes and increased teardrop cells
LDH and haptoglobin normal
Reticulocytes 2.6
SPEP, IFE no monoclonal protein
HCV , HIV nonreactive
Patient started taking vitamin B12 pills
2022-12-08 plt 27
2022-12-15 plt 24 Patient started prednisone 60 mg daily and pantoprazole
2022-12-15
BONE MARROW ASPIRATE:
THERE IS NO DETECTABLE IMMUNOPHENOTYPIC EVIDENCE OF ACUTE LEUKEMIA OR INCREASE IN BLASTS.
NO ABNORMAL B-CELL, T-CELL OR NK-CELL POPULATIONS IDENTIFIED.
Interval History
Patient returned to clinic for interval evaluation. He is accompanied by his wife. Since 2022-12-15 he developed itching initially in pelvis area and later spread into lower part of the body. He reports generalized fatigue, blurry vision, dizziness, tingling in lower extremities. He stopped taking prednisone and PPI on 2022-12-22. Last alcohol use week ago. He reports that he has been diagnosed with borderline diabetes in the past.
Past Medical History
Abdominal aortic aneurysm
CAD (coronary artery disease)
Cardiomyopathy
Carotid artery stenosis
CHF (congestive heart failure)
Diabetes mellitus
History of coronary artery bypass grafting
History of myocardial infarction
Hyperlipidemia
Peripheral vascular disease
Hypertension
Hepatitis C
Chronic kidney disease
Procedure/Surgical History
•Repair Endovascular Abdominal Aorta (2022-08-29)•Endarterectomy Carotid Artery (Left) (2022-06-06)•Carotid Endovascular Stent Placement (Right) (2022-04-18)•Heart stent x2 (2021-10-01)•CABG X4
Social History
Patient smoked 20 cigarettes daily for more than 30 years, quit in 7/2021
He drinks 12 beers and 4 shots of liquor daily
Married, has 2 children
Currently does not work, in the past driver
Family History
Coronary heart disease: Father and Brother.
Diabetes mellitus: Mother and Father.
HDL - High density lipoprotein cholesterol: Father and Brother.
Heart attack: Father and Brother.
Heart disease: Father and Brother.
Hypertension: Father and Brother.

Constitutional: [No fevers, chills, sweats, weight loss, present fatigue]
Eye: [Present recent visual problems, no eye discharge, eye pain, redness]
HEENT: [No ear pain, sinus congestion, sore throat, voice changes]
Respiratory: [No shortness of breath, cough, pain on breathing, sputum production]
Cardiovascular: [No chest pain, palpitations, syncope]
Gastrointestinal: [No nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation]
Genitourinary: [No hematuria, dysuria, incontinence]
Hem/Lymph: [Negative for bruising tendency, swollen lymph glands, nosebleeds]
Endocrine: [Negative for excessive thirst, excessive hunger, excessive urination, heat or cold intolerance]
Musculoskeletal: [No joint pain, muscle pain, decreased range of motion]
Integumentary: [No rash, present pruritus, no abrasions, lesions]
Neurologic: [Present weakness, numbness, no headaches, tremors, blackouts]
Psychiatric: [No anxiety, depression, hallucinations]

T: 35.7 °C T: 96.3 °F (Oral) TMIN: 35.7 °C TMAX: 96.3 °F (Oral) HR: 91 (Peripheral) RR: 18 BP: 111/69 SpO2: 100% WT: 75.68 kg BMI: 26.9
General: alert and oriented, not in acute distress
HEENT: normocephalic, no scleral icterus, no sinus tenderness
Heart: normal rate, regular rhythm, no murmur, gallop
Lungs: clear breath sounds bilaterally, non-labored respiration
Abdomen: soft, non-tender, non-distended, normal bowel sounds, no hepatosplenomegaly, no masses
Extremities: no edema
Lymph nodes: no palpable lymphadenopathy

Patient is 53 y/o male with coronary artery disease s/p MI and CABG, peripheral vascular disease, hepatitis C, alcohol use referred to clinic due to thrombocytopenia.
#1 Thrombocytopenia
Laboratory tests today showed platelets 67
Patient took prednisone 60 mg daily since 2022-12-15 until 2022-12-22
Bone marrow biopsy done on 2022-12-15, aspirate normal, core pending
Hold steroids, will repeat CBC in 2 weeks
#2 Vitamin B12 deficiency
Continue vitamin B12 pills
#3 Diabetes mellitus/hyponatremia
Laboratory tests today showed glucose 767, sodium 116, potassium 5.6
Patient reports generalized weakness, blurry vision.
He will be transferred to ER for further management
Follow up in 2 weeks
Diagnosis:
#1 Thrombocytopenia
#2 Vitamin B12 deficiency
cc
PCP
Bennett, NP-FAM
Vascular surgeon
Amit Dwivedi, MD

predniSONE 20 mg oral tablet 80 mg = 4 Tab, Oral, Daily

Vitamin B12 1000 mcg oral tablet 1,000 mcg = 1 Tab, Oral, Daily

Patient: HINKLE, Sandra Andrew MRN: - fin:s2312983856
Age: 53 Years Sex: Male DOB: 1969-12-05

Patient called that he developed itching in skin of the pelvis area. No rash or edema.
I prescribed Benadryl Po as needed. He also can stop pantoprazole and see if it helps. Other possible explanation is allergy to lidocaine which he received during bone marrow biopsy.
He denies any new detergent.
He is unable to come today to clinic but he is scheduled for labs and appointment on 2022-12-04
